metadata.title: UNMIK Investigation Report: Pristina Airport Tender Irregularities Case 286/04

overview: The investigation focuses on the reported non-existence of Vendors 3 and 4 in Pristina Airport tenders. Vendor 4 was found not to exist and Vendor 3 was identified as a supermarket in Prizren, indicating irregularities in the tender process.

applicable_laws.excerpt: Procurement Regulation in force at the time

methodology.description: The investigation involved interviews and consultations with the Kosovo Organised Crime Bureau (KOCB) and legal entities, as well as a review of ITF case documents related to the allegations.

background.context: Investigation into suspected misrepresentation of Vendors 3 and 4 in Pristina Airport tenders to determine their existence and participation legitimacy.
timeline: 2004-12-01: Contact with the International Prosecutor for legal assessment

allegations.description: Doubts were raised regarding the existence of Vendors 3 and 4 participating in tenders.
allegations.findings: Vendor 4 does not exist in Pristina, and Vendor 3 is confirmed to be a supermarket in Prizren, not a legitimate bidder in the airport tenders.

findings: Vendors 3 and 4 do not legitimately exist as competitors in the tenders.
This case represents an administrative irregularity with breaches of procurement rules.

actions: Provide procurement training to airport staff to adhere to regulations.
Ensure fair competition and verify the legitimacy of bidding companies.
